snippet: The authority held the most visible meeting of its board of commissioners in many years, with its new chairman inviting public comment on matters before, instead of after, the board voted on them.
abstract: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, one year after intentional tie-up of traffic at George Washington Bridge highlighted its secretive culture, holds most visible meeting of its board of commissioners in years; board invites public comment on matters before board votes on them, instead of after; move comes as authority prepares to adopt liberal policy on responding to requests for documents.
lead_paragraph: The authority held the most visible meeting of its board of commissioners in many years, with its new chairman inviting public comment on matters before, instead of after, the board voted on them.

headline.main: With New Leader After Bridge Scandal, Port Authority Moves to Add Transparency
